snippet.title: Shujinkou Gameplay Trailer - Labyrinths
snippet.description:
Learn about some of the various Labyrinth (or 迷宮, Meikyuu) mechanics in this brand new Gameplay Trailer, released during the 2020 Tokyo Game Show! Check out our online booth here: 

Shujinkou (主人公) is an in-development Japanese role playing game that focuses on story and gameplay while allowing players to learn and use Japanese to save the world and defeat the 'Akuma'. Targeting the PC, PS4, and Nintendo Switch, Shujinkou will facilitate learning Japanese in its main story from the JLPT N5 to N3 standards.

Shujinkou on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1386630/Shujinkou/
Rice Games: https://www.ricegames.net/

We have designed Shujinkou so that those who are native or fluent in the language will have an equally, if not more fulfilling, experience using a language they have command of in this 50+ hour epic. Shujinkou provides players with a world that has so seamlessly integrated the Japanese language and culture integrated such that every battle, NPC conversation, and more, will teach them something new.

With an art style influenced by modern JRPGs and a modernized style of Ukiyo-e, a Music Team led by Brian LaGuardia, a formal apprentice to The Avengers' Alan Silvestri, and Programmers that attended prestigious universities like UCLA, Stanford, Cornell and have work experience at companies including Panasonic, Unity, and Microsoft, the team at RICE GAMES is gearing up to provide the ultimate language-infused gaming experience to gamers around the world that are passionate about everything Japanese!
